page.title: 15ECOLOGY OF S.E.BOLDRE
page.content: Being within 1.5 miles of a marshy coastline in the middle of the South Coast and comprising farmland, heathland,bogs,woodland and villages there is a wonderful and plentiful assortment of flora and forna. In the spring redshank and curlew breed in the bogs.Shellduck nest in rabbit holes.Nightingales inhabit patches of deciduous trees and nightjars like the heather near an enclosure.The rare smooth snake and sand lizard are on the heathland where there are 3 types of heather;ling,bell and cross-leaved. The heath spotted orchid thrives in the boggy areas,Sundew abounds. Stove- chats chatter from the tops of the gorse bushes while Dartford warblers sulk below.Roe,fallow,red and muntjac deer come and go from nearby areas.The climate is less severe than in most of Britain,kinder to the natural life.
